quizInfo.Subject: Philippine Popular Culture
quizInfo.Title: First and Second Module
References: Any external links/handouts should be referenced here

quizData.question: What are three popular culture milestones that existed among ancient societies?
What era did Western composers began to commit their music into paper and share it to other musicians?
What culture stems from the ideas and tendencies of the working class to sort out the ones that shall be kept for their importance and consumer value?
What fashion trend was happening around the Medieval period in the West?
quizData.answer: Aristocrats and the royalty began to wear clothes that took these pieces of clothing beyond functionality; the working class began to emulate these outfits.
choices: Aristocrats and the royalty began to wear clothes that took these pieces of clothing beyond functionality; the working class began to emulate these outfits.
Fashion was determined by cultural caste.

quizData.question: Who is the English playwright whose works bridged both fine art and popular art, making his works appeal to many?
What period in history did globalization start to occur?
What illegal drug almost ruined China because the British voyagers introduced it to their black market?
What substance, previously used in Mesoamerican rituals, became an instant hit to the European market due to the upcoming slave trade boom?
What canal was completed that allowed the Philippines the access to the popular cultures of the West, which included novels, knowledge, and music, among other things back in the 1860s?
What is a solemn rite dedicated for two (2) humans to form a pact between them to love each other and make their lives work as one -- usually under the providence of their preferred deity?
Who referenced Raymon Williams in defining word --culure--?
It itself is a way of living.
It is the only thing that makes a group of people a part of culture.
quizData.answer: if they agreed to observe it
choices: if they agreed to observe it

quizData.question:
Example of culture:
Each class is divided into different social -cliques- with each clique having their own shared hobbies, conversations, and agreed norms.
If you try to exclude yourself with other --tribes-- in your classroom, you will know the difference between your --social tribe-- and you classmates.
Who defined culture as --the best that has been thought and said in the world.--
Matthew Arnold feared that since working-class men began to enter politics,his idea of culture might collapse since anarchy is not behind.
Shuck's perspective is considered a vital point in studying culture.
His point of view suggests that his view is an elitist perspective
J-pop, visual kei, anime and crazy-upbeat local commercials are icons from which country?
The Beatles, Spice Girls, Doctor Who, Mr.Bean are icons from which country?
Elvis Presley, the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Vogue, Ted Bundy, and Coen Brothers are icons from which country?
Che Guevara is an icon from which country?
These are the three major spectra of culture.
This culture spectrum is what we usually associate with intelectual discourse, high-brow comedy, and elaborate literature.
It reflects the best aesthetics of a particular society.
Wolfgang Mozart's The Magic Flute is an example of what spectrum of culture?
Gitanjali by Rabindranath Tagore is an example of what spectrum of culture?
Lucresia Kasilag's Philippine Scenes is an example of what spectrum of culture?
Pyotr Tchakovsky's The Nutcracker is an example of what spectrum of culture?
It is an opera compsed by the late Austrian composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart based on the libretto made by Emanual Schikaneder.
It is one of the many Western compositions that reflect the best aesthetics in terms of orchestration and storytelling.
It is a colelction of poems which talks about man's beliefs and spirituality, written by Rabindranath Tagore.
It utilizes the Philippines' fold musical intruments and includes some vocal noises.
It is one of many important cultural heritages of India.
These elements invoke a sense of locality we Filipinos reminisce about during festivals and viewing local sceneries.
It is a famous Christmas ballet perfomed worldwide.
It was compsed and written by Pyotr Tchaikovsky.
It is so iconic; many people associate Christmastime with watching it.
It is roughly described as something shared first in a certain gorup of people before being diseminated to the general population.
It means traditions, music, and anything else practiced by a certain group is exclusively theirs until they share it with the rest.
When traced to its old Norse-English-German origin, describes an army or a small group of people.
It is stable over time as long as people practice it but remains variable across geohraphies.
These give us a rich diversity and a plethora of regional and ethnic music, way of living, and beliefs, among practices.
choices: diverse regions contribute unique musical traditions
ethnicities bring their own belief systems, rituals, and spiritual practices
regional festivals showcase vibrant customs, costumes, and rituals

quizData.question: Paruparong Bukid, Atin Cu Pung Singsing, and Leron, Leron Sinta are examples of what spectrum of culture?
Dances such as Tinikling, Singkil, and Pandanggo sa Ilaw are examples of what spectrum of culture?
Festivals such as Ati-Atihan, Higantes, and Sinulog are examples of what spectrum of culture?
Folk icons such as Malakas and Maganda, Pilandok and various mythological gods and entities are examples of what spectrum of culture?
It encompasses the intellectual and sophicticated aspects of culture.
It represents the exlusive representation of culture.
It is the middleman among the specturm of culture.
It is also called mass or mainstream culture in some references.
It is defined as the collection of traditions and material culture of a particular society.
It can only be as timeless as the prople who know them -- if no one knows about it nor can access them, its essence fades.
It is sometimes called low culture.
It is anything that the general population can access easily.
Popular culture is simply a culture that is widely favored by few people.
Popular culture is whatever is left after you have identified what --high culture-- is
What definition of popular culture argues that popular culture is considered inferior because of its accessibility.
quizData.answer: Popular culture is whatever is left after you have identified what --high culture-- is.
choices: Popular culture is simply a culture that is widely favored (or well- liked) by many people.
Popular culture is whatever is left after you have identified what --high culture-- is.
Popular culture is folk culture, something that arises from people rather than imposed upon them.
Popular culture can be defined as commercial objects that are produced for mass consumption by non-discriminating consumers.

quizData.question: What definition of popular culture argues that popular culture is authentic (created by the people) instead of commercial (thrust upon them by commercial enterprises).
quizData.answer: Popular culture can be defined as commercial objects that are produced for mass consumption by non-discriminating consumers.
choices: Popular culture is folk culture, something that arises from the people rather than imposed upon them.
Popular culture is simply a culture that is widely favored (or well- liked) by many people.
Popular culture is simply a culture that is widely favored (or well- liked) by many people.

quizData.question: What definition of popular culture argues that users are free to embrace some manufactured content, alter it for their own use, or reject it entirely and create their own.
quizData.answer: In the postmodern world (i.e., today), the distinction between --authentic-- versus --commercial-- is blurred
choices: In the postmodern world (i.e., today), the distinction between --authentic-- versus --commercial-- is blurred
Popular culture is simply a culture that is widely favored (or well- liked) by many people.
Popular culture is simply a culture that is widely favored (or well- liked) by many people.

quizData.question: Which of the following is not a category of Popular Culture?
It encompasses varied forms of media, but it usually includes television, film, music, and literature.
This category covers any new trend that people perform and/or consume, including fashion, art, dance, language, and food trends.
This covers anything related to traditional sports, including printed merchandise and icons and electronic sports.
This category covers any news event that has gained significant attention -- intenional or otherwise, positive or negative, which has shaped public opinion about it.
This category encompasses anything and everything politics-related, which includes politicians and political events.
This category encompasses new media forms, inlcuding social media, gadgets, video games, and general internet culture.
This category overlaps with with sports in terms of eSports and entertainment because of social media.
What are the three subsets of culture?
choices: folk culture, pop culture, and high culture
folk culture, pop culture, and low culture

quizData.question: It is a particular culture contained in a larger culture (sometimes reffered to as its parent culture)
Aeta culture is an example of what subset of culture?
Ballet culture is an example of what subset of culture?
Rico Mambo culture is an example of what subset of culture?
Hippi culture is an example of what subset of culture?
Punk culture is an example of what subset of culture?
It is formed when a certain group begins to oppose the established normas of popular culture and breaks off from the parent culture they came from.
It is a subculture with which a person can affiliiate themselves while existing, interacting, and negotiating within a parent culture.
Filipino-American culture is an example of what subset of culture?
This process of soul-searching,which also affects the dynamics and structure of culture, is called ______?
